context: The word 'eksid' is the 3rd person singular present form of the Estonian verb 'eksima'. It can mean to go astray from the correct path, to get lost physically, or to make mistakes/errors in judgment, behavior, or understanding. The word has multiple meanings depending on context - it can refer to literal wandering off a path, accidental arrival somewhere, making errors in actions or thoughts, or violating rules/morals.
